2 a.definition: standing or acting for another esp. through delegated authority [an agent acting in a capacity]

sub_terms.b: of, based on, or constituting a government in which the people are represented by individuals chosen from among them usually by election

3.definition: of or relating to representationnone that represents another or others in a special capacity

sub_terms.a: one that represents a constituency as a member of a legislative or other governing bodya member of the House of Representatives of the U.S. Congress or a state legislature
sub_terms.b: one that represents another as agent, deputy, substitute, or delegate and that usually is invested with the authority of the principal
sub_terms.c: one that represents or stands in the place of a deceased person
sub_terms.d: one that represents another as successor or heir
sub_terms.e: one named as the plaintiff or defendant in a class action to litigate on behalf of the class
